AG | Update APK version number for Play Store

title: AG | Update APK version number for Play Store
message:
AG | Update APK version number for Play Store

Motivation:

* while we build the React Native version of this app,
  we want contributors and users to be able to access
  the most recent version of the vestigal app
* the version at master/HEAD has several new changes, including:
  * app starts on load on the map page with location sharing on
  * preserves polling state correctly
* BUT: the version on the Play Store lacks these changes
* AND: to publish a new APK, we need to bump the version number

Actions:

* package and sign a new APK with most recent changes
* give a new version number to the APK
* publish to the Play Store

TO-DO:

* document the process of signing and publishing an APK
* figure out a strategy for sharing (or not sharing) signing credentials

title: Preserve state across instances of OnOffActivity
message:
Preserve state across instances of OnOffActivity

* BUG:

    changes to polling state are lost
  * as a result, button starts with wrong color, pressing it yields
    incorrect effects on location polling
* FIX:

    if activity is stopped or destroyed)

    AndroidManifest

Encapsulate all Google Map functionality within Adapter classes

title: Class, variable renaming
message:
Class, variable renaming

* To more clearly signal design pattern being used,
  replace all instances of `Map/MarkerContainer` with `Map/MarkerAdapter`
* To more clearly signal use of Abstract Factory pattern,
  replace `MapAdapterFactory#getInstance` with `MapAdapterFactory#createMapAdapter`

title: Encapsulate all Google Map functionality
message:
Encapsulate all Google Map functionality

In order to facilitate swapping out Google Maps for OSM:

* Create `MapContainer` and `MarkerContainer` interfaces
* Create `GoogleMapContainer` and `GoogleMarkerContainer` subclasses
  that:
    * implement the `MapContainer` and `MarkerContainer` interfaces
    * encapsulate underlying `GoogleMap` and (Google) `Marker` classes
      as protected fields
    * delegate interface-specified method calls to corresponding
      Google-specific implementations in encapsulated child classes
* Use concrete subclasses of abstract `MapContainerFactory`
  to instantiate appropriate subclasses of `MapContainer`
* __Payoff:__ to introduce OpenStreetMaps implementation, merely
  create `OSMMapContainer` and `OSMMarkerContainer` classes that
  implement `MapContainer` and `MarkerContainer` interfaces and delegate
  to corresponding OSM-specific methods

Side-effects:

* move 50% of code from `Mapper` into `MapContainer` subclasses, producing:
  * greater separation of concerns between `Mapper` and
    `MapContainer` (the former manages changes, the latter produces them)
  * vastly increased testability of `Mapper` class (due to encapsulation
    of untestable Google code within `MapContainer`)
* New hand-rolled `LatLon` class to abstract over varying implementations
  of LatLng (along with room to convert between different representations)
* various tightening-up refactors and renamings

title: Bug fix: write incoming locs to DB when map not showing
message:
Bug fix: write incoming locs to DB when map not showing

* BUG: when switching from `MapActivity` to `OnOffActivity` and back,
  location updates received while viewing `OnOffActivity` aren't reflected on map
* CAUSE: locations returned from `WhereatApiClient`
  weren't being written to DB by `LocationPublisher`
* FIX: subscribe `LocationPublisher.mWhereatClient#remove` to `#record` method
      * `#record` broadcasts location and saves it to DB
      * now, when `MapActivity#refresh` called, it picks up locs added to DB while viewing other activities

* side-effects:
  * remove "single-instance" attribute from `MapActivity` in `AndroidManifest` (unnecessary)
  * remove `OnOffActivity#onDestory` (its function is obsolete since it `OnOffActivity` doesn't control`LocPubManager` anymore)
  * fill in missing tests for `LocationPublisher`

  * weird flags removed from menu

title: DEBUG: Fix sequence for enabling Play Services
message:
DEBUG: Fix sequence for enabling Play Services

__Effect on user:__

* when user first loads app and doesn't know about Play Services, app
  should guide them to set it up instead of crashing mysteriously

__Bug Fix__

* BUG: if play services disabled, app crashes with NPE
* CAUSE: `LocationPublisher` is trying to use uninitialized `mBroadcast`
  field to broadcast problem to rest of app
* FIX:
  * initialize `mBroadcast` earlier in lifecycle (in `#onCreate` instead
    of `#initialize`) so that its defined in scope of `#onStartCommand` call
  * byproduct: add tests for `#onCreate` and `#onStartCommand` methods
    of `LocationPublisher` class

title: Cleanup: avoid garbage collection on pref listener
message:
Cleanup: avoid garbage collection on pref listener

* as per [this guide](http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/ui/settings.html#Listening)
  best practice is to store a strong reference to
  instances of `OnSharedPreferenceChangeListener` to avoid listeners
  being swept up by garbage collection (since system stores a weak
  reference by default)
* implementation:
  * add `LocationPublisher#mPrefListener` field, use lambda instead of
  * anonymouse class
* side effects:
  * remove extraneous code during hunt for other anonymous classes to replace
  * clean up tests (removing mocks on classes that are now lambdas)

title: Bug fix: forget canceling fubar
message:
Bug fix: forget canceling fubar

* bug 1: `Scheduler#broadcastForget` initially broadcasts `expiration` time of 0L
  * cause: `LocationPublisher.mTtl` not initialized on first call to `#forget`
  * fix: add call to `LocationPublisher#getTtlPref` in `#initialize`
* bug 2: when second forget scheduled, first one not cancelled
  * cause: `Scheduler#forget` storing runnable as local var instead of field
  * fix: store as field, pass field to `#cancelForget`

title: Bug fix: register receivers in `SetingsActivity`
message:
Bug fix: register receivers in `SetingsActivity`

* bug: notifications not showing up in `SettingsActivity`
* cause: broadcast receivers not registered
* fix:

  * add `onPause` callback that unregisters receivers
* side effects:
  * clean up tests for `MainActivity` life cycle methods

title: `LocationPublisher` updates `mTtl` on pref changes
message:
`LocationPublisher` updates `mTtl` on pref changes

* extract common `mPrefs` field for use by all `LocationPublisher`

* reset `mTtl` and reschedule `mScheduler#forget` whenever ttl pref
  changes

  `#resetPollInterval()` to reflect new structure

title: Auto-update summary of loc sharing interval pref
message:
Auto-update summary of loc sharing interval pref

* When location sharing interval preference changes, so does `summary`
  field of location sharing interval preference
* KEY INSIGHT: use `"%s"` in `summary` field of `preferences.xml` rather
  than convoluted implementation of `onSharedPreferenceChanged` callback!!!

title: Update location polling interval from prefs
message:
Update location polling interval from prefs

* Paramaterize polling interval
  * Change `LocationPublisher.POLLIING_INTERVAL` from constant to mutable
  field `mPollInterval`
  * Initialize `mPollInterval` from prefs
  * Extract building of `mLocReq` into reusable method

* Whenever polling interval preference changes:
  * trigger callback to...
  * update `mPollInterval`
  * rebuild `mLocReq` with new polling interval
  * restart location polling (if polling currently turned on)

title: Extract MenuHelper module, refactor file structure
message:
Extract MenuHelper module, refactor file structure

MenuHelper extraction:

* extract menu logic to a `MenuHelper` class
* add `mMenu` field to all Activities with menus
* delegate `SomeActivity#onCreateOptionsMenu` to `mMenu#create`
* delegate `SomeActivity#onMenuOptionsSelected` to `mMenu#select`
* use lambdas for callbacks, huzzah!
* move all tests for result of menu events to `MenuHelperTests` (avoids
  testing same logic N times -- where N is number of activities)
* in activities, test only that delegation to `mMenu` took place

File Structure changes:

* move `api`, `pubsub`, and `db` packages to `modules` package
* create `modules.ui` package, put `MenuHelper` class in it, move
  `PopToast` class to it as `Toaster`
* create `modules.schedule` package, put `Scheduler` class in it
* create `modules.map` package, put `Mapper` class in it
* create `services` package, put `LocPubManager` and `LocationPublisher`
  classes in it

title: Fix bug with `PreferenceFragment` sketch
message:
Fix bug with `PreferenceFragment` sketch

* bug cause: Ints are not a valid type for `ListPreference` elements
  * must use strings and cast to Int or Long
  * replaced `pref_loc_share_interval_ints` with array of strings
  * renamed ...`interval_ints` to `interval_values`,
  * ...`interval_strings` to `interval_labels`
* previously failing tests now pass
* added summary and tests for full contents
* set default values for all preferences from
  `MainActivity#onCreate` (first possible execution point in app)

title: Fix loc subscribe bug, refactor `LocationPublisher`
message:
Fix loc subscribe bug, refactor `LocationPublisher`

BUG FIX

* cause: `LocationPublisher#mLocSub` was only being called once
* fix: make `mLocSub` an `Action1<UserLocation>` (lambda) instead of `Subscription<UserLocation>`
* revise test for `LocationPublisher#update` to substitute `TestSubscriber<>::onNext` for `mLocSub`, run tests on `TestSubscriber` instance

REFACTOR

* goal: increase readability/maintainability of `LocationPublisher` class
* extract broadcasters from `LocationPublisher` into separate `LocPubBroadcasters` class
* shorten method names
* remove unnecessary helper functions
* create testing seam with `mLocProvider` field, (set to `FusedApiLocationProvider` in prod)
* add tests

title: Refactor `MapActivity`
message:
Refactor `MapActivity`

* extract all functionality pertaining to google map and hash map of
  markers into new `Mapper` class, child of `MapActivity`
* create gnarly testing seams for `Mapper` to get around closed status
  of `GoogleMap` classes
* add tests for MapActivity

NEW BUG:
* map no longer displays markers from other users
* to be fixed in next commit

title: Squash extra notification bug
message:
Squash extra notification bug

* Bug: `MainActivity` and `MapActivity` showing spurious empty notification on calls to `forget`
* Cause: Failure to remove `SchedulerReceivers` class as child of `MainActivityReceivers` and `MapActivityReceivers`

Side effects of bug-squashing:

* remove `dao` as parameter to `Scheduler#forget` (no longer needed)
* use Factory for instantiating `Scheduler` (makes for easier testing seam)
* clean up typing (long for string) in tests of `LocationNotificationReceivers`
* revise tests for `Scheduler` for increased brevity and to replace references to `dao`

title: Implement forgetting on `MapActivity`, clean up
message:
Implement forgetting on `MapActivity`, clean up

* move `SchedulerReceivers#forgetReceiver` to `LocationNotificationReceivers`
* add `#forgetReceiver` to `LocationMappingReceivers`
* add logic to `MapActivity` for performing forget on `GoogleMap` object
* wrap GoogleMap markers in Pair<Long,Markers> so as to lookup, delete by time
* remove `SchedulerReceivers` and references in `MainActivitReceivers` and `MapActivityReceivers`
* add shorter intervals for testing `forget` functionality
* NOTE: contains bug in which `broadcastForget` is being called twice -- don't know why!

title: Add & refactor broadcast receivers
message:
Add & refactor broadcast receivers

* Add broadcast receivers for `Scheduler`
* Refactor Broadcast Receiver architecture
  * Achieve separation of concerns & code-sharing w/ 4 classes that implement `Receiver`:
    * `LocationNotificationReceivers`
    * `LocationMappingReceivers`
    * `GoogleApiReceivers`
    * `ScheduleReceivers`
  * `MainReceivers` and `MapReceivers` compose these classes, mixing in ones they need, sharing others
  * Refactor all alerts triggered by receivers to use fragments
  * replace all strings with references to xml resources
  * add tests for all receivers and alert fragments
* Refactor tests for `LocationPublisher`
  * eliminate reflection by using protected fields and methods in same package as class under test
  * create testing seam for `LocationPublisher#update`:
    * add `locSub` field to `LocationPublisherManager`
    * when not under test, delegate to `#broadcastLocationReceived`
    * when under test, delegate to `TestSubscriber<UserLocation>`
* Add vestigal support for more advanced rxJava tests

title: Add `forget` broadcast receivers to `LocSubMain`
message:
Add `forget` broadcast receivers to `LocSubMain`
